org.araneaframework.core.util
Class ProxiedHandlerUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.core.util.ProxiedHandlerUtil

public abstract class ProxiedHandlerUtil
extends Object

Utility class for accessing methods that will be invocation targets of ProxyEventListener and ProxyActionListener. Note that this class is used centrally so that rules described here are global to Aranea.

The general rule is that for every incoming action ("actionId"), the target method will be resolved by name handleAction[ActionId](...). For every incoming event, the target method will be resolved exactly the same way, except the method prefix has to be "handleEvent". The target method may accept (in the following order)

  • no parameters at all;
  • a single string parameter (which is null, when no parameter is provided);
  • a single string array parameter (which is empty, when no parameter is provided);
  • a single List of strings parameter (which is empty, when no parameter is provided);
  • a single Map of strings parameter (which is empty, when no parameter is provided);
The first resolved handler will be used, others will be ignored.

For array and list parameters, the incoming request parameter will be splitted by a separator (the one provided by widget's getParameterSeparator() method, if exists, or by semicolon, which is default). For the map parameter, the array/list values will be splitted by the equals (=) symbol so that the left side would become key and the right side would become value. Unlike the list values separator, the equals symbol is not customizable.

The support for action/event handler array, list, and map parameters came in Aranea 2.0.

Since:
1.0.12
Author:
Taimo Peelo (taimo@araneaframework.org), Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)

Constant Field Values

PARAMETER_SEPARTOR_RESOLVER

public static final String PARAMETER_SEPARTOR_RESOLVER
The name of an optional method the target widget may have. The method is supposed to take no parameters and return a string (a separator) that will be used for splitting action/event parameter into an array, list, or map. When the method is not provided, ";" will be used as the separator.

Since:
2.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

The default separator used for splitting action/event parameter into an array, list, or map.

2.0

Method Detail

getHandlerName

public static String getHandlerName(String handlerPrefix,
                                    String handlerId)
The general rule for constructing handler names: handlerPrefix + handlerId = handlerPrefixHandlerId. Using null as a parameter value won't cause any exceptions, so do it at your own risk!

Parameters:
handlerPrefix - The prefix of the returned string.
handlerId - The suffix of the returned string. The first letter will be capitalized.
Returns:
The concatenated strings where the second parameter has its first letter capitalized.

hasEmptyHandler

public static boolean hasEmptyHandler(Object target,
                                      String methodName)
Provides whether the target has the given handler method that takes no parameters.

Parameters:
target - The widget that is expected to have a handler.
methodName - The name of the method that the target should have.
Returns:
true when the target has the method with given name and the method takes no parameters.

hasHandler

public static boolean hasHandler(Object target,
                                 String methodName,
                                 Class<?>... params)
Provides whether the target has the given handler method that takes given parameters.

Parameters:
target - The widget that is expected to have a handler.
methodName - The name of the method that the target should have.
params - The classes the parameters should have in the given order.
Returns:
true when the target has the method with given name and the method takes no parameters.

invokeEventHandler

public static void invokeEventHandler(String eventId,
                                      String eventParam,
                                      Widget eventTarget)
                               throws Exception
Invokes the method of eventTarget that can handle the event eventId. The method that will be invoked, will also be logged at DEBUG level. In case when no event handler is found, it will log it at WARN level.

This method tries to invoke even handlers in the given order (the method quits after a method has been found and invoked):

  1. eventTarget.handleEvent[EventId]()
  2. eventTarget.handleEvent[EventId](String) (eventParam)
  3. eventTarget.handleEvent[EventId](String[]) (eventParam split into an array at every ';' symbol)
  4. eventTarget.handleEvent[EventId](List) (eventParam split into a list at every ';' symbol)
  5. eventTarget.handleEvent[EventId](Map) (eventParam split into entries at every ';' symbol and into key and value at the first '=' symbol in every entry)

Parameters:
eventId - The event that should be called. It is used to look up the right method.
eventParam - An optional parameter to be provided to the handler.
eventTarget - The widget that is expected to handle this event by providing a corresponding event handler.
Throws:
Exception - Any unexpected exception that may occur (e.g. while invoking the method).

invokeActionHandler

public static void invokeActionHandler(String actionId,
                                       String actionParam,
                                       Widget actionTarget)
                                throws Exception
Invokes the method of actionTarget that can handle the action actionId. The method, that will be invoked, will also be logged at DEBUG level. In case when no action handler is found, it will log it at WARN level.

The following algorithm explains its work:

  1. look for a method: actionTarget.handleAction[ActionId](); if found, invoke it, and quit this method.
  2. look for a method: actionTarget.handleAction[ActionId](String); if found, invoke it with actionParam, and quit this method.
  3. look for a method: actionTarget.handleAction[ActionId](String[]); if found, split actionParam into array at every ';' symbol, invoke it with created array as its parameter, and quit this method.

Parameters:
actionId - The action that should be called. It is used to look up the right method.
actionParam - An optional parameter to be provided to the handler.
actionTarget - The widget that is expected to handle this action by providing a corresponding action handler.
Throws:
Exception - Any unexpected exception that may occur (e.g. while invoking the method).

log

public static void log(String handlerName,
                       String param,
                       String className)
Logs the calling of a handler method.

Parameters:
handlerName - The complete method name that is to be called.
param - An optional parameters signature. Use empty string for no parameters.
className - The class of the instance object to be called.

splitParam

public static String[] splitParam(Widget target,
                                  String param)
This method contains central logic for splitting action/event parameter value into multiple strings (no nulls nor empty strings!).

Parameters:
target - The target widget of the incoming action/event. Used for resolving parameter separator.
param - The parameter to be splitted. May be null.
Returns:
An array of strings containing the splitted parameter. In case of null, an empty array.
Since:
2.0

parseParamList

public static List<String> parseParamList(Widget target,
                                          String param)
Parses the parameter to make a list out of it. The list items are the same as array items from #splitParam(String).

Parameters:
target - The target widget of the incoming action/event. Used for resolving parameter separator.
param - The parameter to be splitted. May be null.
Returns:
A list of strings containing the splitted parameter. In case of null, an empty list.
Since:
2.0

parseParamMap

public static Map<String,String> parseParamMap(Widget target,
                                               String param)
Parses the parameter to make a map out of it. Map rows are parsed as in #splitParam(String). For each row, the row is splitted at first "=" symbol (the first part is key, the other is value), while empty Strings are replaced with nulls.

Parameters:
target - The target widget of the incoming action/event. Used for resolving parameter separator.
param - The parameter to be splitted. May be null.
Returns:
A map of strings (keys, values) containing the splitted parameter. In case of null, an empty map.
Since:
2.0

logHandlerNotFound

public static void logHandlerNotFound(String prefix,
                                      String handlerId,
                                      Widget target)
Logs a warning message that a target handler, i.e. a method named [prefix][HandlerId](...), was not found.

Parameters:
prefix - It should match either "handleAction" or "handleEvent".
handlerId - The sent action or event ID.
target - The target widget that should respond to the action or event.
